meanings.definition: A person who lives a solitary life and avoids others.
meanings.sent1: The recluse in the neighborhood rarely left their house.
meanings.sent2: The old man down the street was known as a recluse because he rarely interacted with anyone.
meanings.sent3: The recluse at the party spent most of the time hiding in the corner.
meanings.sent4: Hermit crabs are like tiny recluse creatures, carrying their homes on their backs.
meanings.sent5: The recluse's isolation from society was so complete that even the birds avoided their home.

meanings.definition: To shut oneself away from the world.
meanings.sent1: Feeling overwhelmed, she decided to recluse herself in her room for the rest of the day.
meanings.sent2: After a long week, he wanted to recluse in the mountains to find peace.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to recluse itself in the closet, thinking it was a good hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: As the storm raged outside, she reclused in her cozy blanket fort.
meanings.sent5: In times of trouble, some people tend to recluse into their own thoughts, seeking solace.
